recommendation: Apply Factor Analysis to identify latent constructs
rationale: Likert batteries often measure underlying dimensions that FA can reveal

recommendation: Use median instead of mean for central tendency
action: report median and IQR instead of mean/std
rationale: Highly skewed distributions make mean misleading

recommendation: Use ANOVA instead of multiple t-tests
rationale: Multiple t-tests inflate Type I error; ANOVA controls family-wise error

recommendation: Use Paired T-Test instead of Independent T-Test
rationale: Paired samples violate independence assumption of independent t-test

recommendation: Use non-parametric alternative
action: switch to Mann-Whitney U or Kruskal-Wallis
rationale: Small non-normal samples violate parametric test assumptions

recommendation: Central Limit Theorem applies - parametric tests acceptable
rationale: CLT ensures sampling distribution normality for large samples

recommendation: Use Spearman instead of Pearson correlation
rationale: Ordinal data violates interval assumption of Pearson

recommendation: Check for multicollinearity before regression
action: calculate VIF and consider removing variables
rationale: Multicollinearity inflates standard errors and makes coefficients unreliable

recommendation: Document missing data pattern and consider imputation
action: analyze MCAR/MAR/MNAR and apply appropriate strategy
rationale: Listwise deletion with >5% missing can bias results

recommendation: Variable may be unreliable - consider exclusion
action: evaluate if variable should be dropped
rationale: High missingness suggests data quality issues

recommendation: Interpret results with caution - limited statistical power
rationale: Small samples have low power to detect true effects

recommendation: Factor Analysis results may be unstable
action: use fewer factors or consider combining with theory
rationale: FA requires ~10 observations per variable minimum

recommendation: Investigate outliers before analysis
action: identify outliers visually and statistically then decide
rationale: Outliers can heavily influence means and correlations

recommendation: Merge small categories or use Fisher's Exact Test
rationale: Chi-square requires expected counts >= 5

recommendation: Calculate NPS and segment into Promoters/Passives/Detractors
rationale: NPS is industry standard metric with specific calculation method

recommendation: Report Top-2-Box and Bottom-2-Box percentages
rationale: T2B/B2B are common satisfaction reporting metrics

recommendation: Avoid pie charts and stacked areas
action: use bar chart or waterfall instead
rationale: Pie/stacked area cannot represent negative values correctly

recommendation: Consider grouping or using horizontal bar chart
action: group into Other or use alternative viz
rationale: Too many categories create visual clutter

recommendation: Use box plots or violin plots instead of bar charts
rationale: Bar charts hide distribution shape and outliers

recommendation: Consider using slope chart or bump chart
rationale: Standard charts may not emphasize change effectively

recommendation: Lead with key findings and recommendations
action: structure report with executive summary first
rationale: Executives have limited time - lead with conclusions

recommendation: Include methodology and statistical details
action: add appendix with full statistical output
rationale: Technical audiences need reproducibility details

recommendation: Use K-Means or Hierarchical clustering on behavioral variables
rationale: Personas require grouping similar respondents

recommendation: Use elbow method or silhouette score to determine K
action: calculate metrics for K=2 to K=10
rationale: Optimal K should be determined empirically

recommendation: Apply word frequency and sentiment analysis first
action: run basic NLP before advanced techniques
rationale: Start with simple text metrics before complex analysis

recommendation: Check for seasonality and trend before modeling
rationale: Understanding components improves forecasting

recommendation: Use ARIMA or Prophet for univariate forecasting
rationale: Proper time series models capture autocorrelation

recommendation: Check if sample weighting is needed to match population
rationale: Unweighted surveys may not represent population

recommendation: Apply weights to all calculations
action: use weighted means and weighted crosstabs
rationale: Ignoring weights produces biased estimates

recommendation: Report effect size alongside p-value
rationale: P-values don't indicate practical significance

recommendation: Apply Bonferroni or FDR correction
action: adjust alpha or use FDR method
rationale: Multiple comparisons inflate false positive rate

recommendation: Check residual normality and homoscedasticity
action: plot residuals and run diagnostic tests
rationale: Violated assumptions invalidate inference

recommendation: Remove or investigate duplicate records
action: check for true duplicates vs valid repeats
rationale: Duplicates can inflate sample size artificially

recommendation: Standardize category labels before analysis
action: clean and map to consistent values
rationale: Inconsistent coding creates fake categories

recommendation: Calculate row percentages for comparison across groups
rationale: Row percentages enable group comparison

recommendation: Calculate column percentages to see composition
rationale: Column percentages show within-group composition

recommendation: Use exploratory analysis first then confirmatory
action: clearly separate EDA from hypothesis testing
rationale: Exploratory findings need confirmation on new data

recommendation: Create reusable analysis pipeline
rationale: Automation reduces errors and saves time

recommendation: Export visualizations at 300 DPI minimum
rationale: High resolution needed for print and presentations

recommendation: Set random seeds and document package versions
rationale: Reproducibility is scientific standard

recommendation: Use survey-stats Factor Analysis for Likert batteries
rationale: Specialized function handles survey data patterns

recommendation: Apply Raking algorithm for sample weighting
rationale: IPF/Raking adjusts sample to match population targets

recommendation: Use survey_stats Clustering for persona creation
rationale: Optimized clustering for survey respondent profiles

recommendation: Use Survey PCA for multi-response data
rationale: Handles string-split multi-response columns

recommendation: Apply TURF Analysis for portfolio optimization
rationale: Maximizes unduplicated reach across products

recommendation: Use weighted bar charts for presentation
rationale: Ensures charts reflect population estimates

recommendation: Consider Latent Class Analysis instead of K-Means
rationale: K-Means assumes continuous features

recommendation: Use Repeated Measures ANOVA or paired tests
rationale: Paired designs need appropriate analysis

recommendation: Use Poisson or Negative Binomial regression
rationale: Linear regression inappropriate for count data

recommendation: Use Ordinal Logistic Regression
rationale: Binary logistic loses ordinal information

recommendation: Calculate Cronbach's Alpha before analysis
rationale: Unreliable scales produce unreliable results

recommendation: Run Confirmatory Factor Analysis to validate structure
rationale: Theory-driven validation required for new instruments

recommendation: Consider Bayesian approach with informative priors
action: use PyMC or Stan for inference
rationale: Bayesian methods incorporate prior knowledge

recommendation: Use Bootstrap for confidence intervals
rationale: Non-parametric CI estimation

recommendation: Use CHAID or CART for segmentation
rationale: Trees provide interpretable decision rules

recommendation: Run Conjoint Analysis for attribute importance
rationale: Conjoint reveals trade-offs consumers make

recommendation: Use MaxDiff instead of simple ranking
rationale: MaxDiff forces trade-offs between items

recommendation: Calculate required sample size before testing
rationale: Underpowered tests waste resources

recommendation: Report confidence intervals not just p-values
action: include effect size and CI bounds
rationale: CIs more informative than significance alone

recommendation: Suggest donut or bar chart instead
rationale: Bar charts easier to compare than pie slices

recommendation: Use histogram or density plot
action: show full distribution not just summary
rationale: Summary statistics hide distribution shape

recommendation: Use overlapping histograms or violin plots
rationale: Side-by-side comparison reveals differences

recommendation: Use scatter plot with regression line
rationale: Visual confirmation of correlation strength

recommendation: Use correlation heatmap
rationale: Heatmaps reveal patterns in correlation matrices

recommendation: Use line chart with clear time axis
rationale: Line charts best for temporal patterns

recommendation: Use colorblind-friendly palette
rationale: ~8% of men have color vision deficiency

recommendation: Use diverging color scale
action: center at meaningful midpoint (0 or mean)
rationale: Diverging scales show deviation from center

recommendation: Use sequential color scale
rationale: Sequential scales show magnitude

recommendation: Use qualitative color palette
rationale: Qualitative palettes distinguish categories

recommendation: Create executive summary slide first
rationale: Busy stakeholders need bottom-line first

recommendation: Structure as situation-complication-resolution
rationale: Stories more memorable than data dumps

recommendation: Use thousands separators
rationale: Improves readability of large numbers

recommendation: Show one decimal place maximum
rationale: More decimals imply false precision

recommendation: Report exact p-values not just significance
rationale: Exact values enable meta-analysis

recommendation: Never claim causation from correlation alone
rationale: Correlation does not imply causation

recommendation: Report effect size to assess practical importance
action: small effects may not be meaningful
rationale: Statistical significance â‰  practical significance

recommendation: Use cross-validation to assess generalization
action: split data or use k-fold CV
rationale: Training accuracy misleading without validation

recommendation: Hold out data for final validation
action: never peek at test set during modeling
rationale: Data leakage invalidates model assessment

recommendation: Create analysis log with decisions and rationale
rationale: Future reviewers need context

recommendation: Add comments and docstrings
rationale: Code should be self-documenting

recommendation: Consider using robust statistics: trimmed mean (scipy.stats.trim_mean), MAD (statsmodels.robust.scale.mad), or median instead of mean/std. These are resistant to outliers.
rationale: Consider using robust statistics: trimmed mean (scipy.stats.trim_mean), MAD (statsmodels.robust.scale.mad), or median instead of mean/std. These are resistant to outliers.

recommendation: Consider permutation test instead of t-test for exact p-values without distributional assumptions. Use scipy.stats.permutation_test or implement custom permutation.
rationale: Consider permutation test instead of t-test for exact p-values without distributional assumptions. Use scipy.stats.permutation_test or implement custom permutation.

condition: Time series data with varying quality over time
recommendation: Consider weighted regression with higher weights for recent/higher-quality data. Use sample_weight parameter in sklearn.linear_model.LinearRegression.
rationale: Consider weighted regression with higher weights for recent/higher-quality data. Use sample_weight parameter in sklearn.linear_model.LinearRegression.

recommendation: Use partial residual plots (statsmodels.graphics.plot_ccpr) to validate polynomial necessity and check for missed nonlinearity.
rationale: Use partial residual plots (statsmodels.graphics.plot_ccpr) to validate polynomial necessity and check for missed nonlinearity.

recommendation: For grayscale publications, use correlation ellipse plots instead of heatmaps. Ellipses show direction and strength without color.
rationale: For grayscale publications, use correlation ellipse plots instead of heatmaps. Ellipses show direction and strength without color.

condition: Need for central tendency with varying observation importance
recommendation: Use weighted median (wquantiles.median) when observations have different importance. More robust than weighted mean for skewed data.
rationale: Use weighted median (wquantiles.median) when observations have different importance. More robust than weighted mean for skewed data.

condition: High outlier count or skewed distribution
recommendation: Use MAD (Median Absolute Deviation) instead of standard deviation for robust variability measure. MAD = median(|X - median(X)|) / 0.6745.
rationale: Use MAD (Median Absolute Deviation) instead of standard deviation for robust variability measure. MAD = median(|X - median(X)|) / 0.6745.

condition: Small sample size (<30) for confidence intervals
recommendation: Consider bootstrap confidence intervals instead of parametric methods. Use sklearn.utils.resample or scipy.stats.bootstrap.
rationale: Consider bootstrap confidence intervals instead of parametric methods. Use sklearn.utils.resample or scipy.stats.bootstrap.
